page.title: 16VILLAGE POLICEMAN,BANKS
page.content: THE" BANKS BEAT" COMES UNDER THE ORMSKIRK DIVISION WITH HEADQUARTERS IN SKELMERSDALE.ALTHOUGH LOCALLY BASED THE BEAT HAS A WIDE BOUNDARY GOING BEYOND THE IMMEDIATE VILLAGE. THE CONSTABLE IS SOMETIMES CALLED ON BY POLICE IN THE NEARBY VILLAGES TO ASSIST THEM IN THEIR WORK.LIKE ALL POLICEMEN HE CARRIES A TRUNCHEON AND A PAIR OF HANDCUFFS AND HAS HIS OWN PERSONAL I.D.NUMBER. EXAMPLES OF THE WORK HE DOES INCLUDE KEEPING ORDER AT SOCIAL EVENTS AND IN CLUBS;BEING CALLED OUT TO THE SCENE OF BURGLARIES;INVESTIGATING THEFTS AND REPORTS OF STOLEN VEHICLES;GOING TO THE SCENE OF ACCIDENTS AND ATTENDING COURT. HE ALSO OCCASIONALLY HELPS IN SCHOOL CROSSING PATROLS. HE LIVES IN THE POLICE HOUSE IN THE VILLAGE.HE MAY BE CALLED OUT AT ANY TIME OUTSIDE HIS WORKING HOURS.
